00036  * lustre/osp/osp_dev.c
00037  *
00038  * Author: Alex Zhuravlev <alexey.zhuravlev@intel.com>

00040  * Author: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

00042 /*
00043  * The Object Storage Proxy (OSP) module provides an implementation of
00044  * the DT API for remote MDTs and OSTs. Every local OSP device (or
00045  * object) is a proxy for a remote OSD device (or object). Thus OSP
00046  * converts DT operations into RPCs, which are sent to the OUT service
00047  * on a remote target, converted back to DT operations, and
00048  * executed. Of course there are many ways in which this description
00049  * is inaccurate but it's a good enough mental model. OSP is used by
00050  * the MDT stack in several ways:
00051  *
00052  * - OSP devices allocate FIDs for the stripe sub-objects of a striped
00053  *   file or directory.
00054  *
00055  * - OSP objects represent the remote MDT and OST objects that are
00056  *   the stripes of a striped object.
00057  *
00058  * - OSP devices log, send, and track synchronous operations (setattr
00059  *   and unlink) to remote targets.
00060  *
00061  * - OSP objects are the bottom slice of the compound LU object
00062  *   representing a remote MDT object: MDT/MDD/LOD/OSP.
00063  *
00064  * - OSP objects are used by LFSCK to represent remote OST objects
00065  *   during the verification of MDT-OST consistency.
00066  *
00067  * - OSP devices batch idempotent requests (declare_attr_get() and
00068  *   declare_xattr_get()) to the remote target and cache their results.
00069  *
00070  * In addition the OSP layer implements a subset of the OBD device API
00071  * to support being a client of a remote target, connecting to other
00072  * layers, and FID allocation.
00073  */
00074 
00075 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_MDS

00087 /* Slab for OSP object allocation */
00088 struct kmem_cache *osp_object_kmem;
00089 
00090 static struct lu_kmem_descr osp_caches[] = {
00091         {
00092                 .ckd_cache = &osp_object_kmem,
00093                 .ckd_name  = "osp_obj",
00094                 .ckd_size  = sizeof(struct osp_object)
00095         },
00096         {
00097                 .ckd_cache = NULL
00098         }

00116 static struct lu_object *osp_object_alloc(const struct lu_env *env,
00117                                           const struct lu_object_header *hdr,
00118                                           struct lu_device *d)
00119 {
00120         struct lu_object_header *h = NULL;
00121         struct osp_object       *o;
00122         struct lu_object        *l;
00123 
00124         OBD_SLAB_ALLOC_PTR_GFP(o, osp_object_kmem, GFP_NOFS);
00125         if (o != NULL) {
00126                 l = &o->opo_obj.do_lu;
00127 
00128                 /* If hdr is NULL, it means the object is not built
00129                  * from the top dev(MDT/OST), usually it happens when
00130                  * building striped object, like data object on MDT or
00131                  * striped object for directory */
00132                 if (hdr == NULL) {
00133                         h = &o->opo_header;
00134                         lu_object_header_init(h);
00135                         dt_object_init(&o->opo_obj, h, d);
00136                         lu_object_add_top(h, l);
00137                 } else {
00138                         dt_object_init(&o->opo_obj, h, d);
00139                 }
00140 
00141                 l->lo_ops = &osp_lu_obj_ops;
00142 
00143                 return l;
00144         } else {
00145                 return NULL;
00146         }
00147 }

00165 static struct dt_object
00166 *osp_find_or_create_local_file(const struct lu_env *env, struct osp_device *osp,
00167                                struct lu_attr *attr, __u32 reg_id)
00168 {
00169         struct osp_thread_info *osi = osp_env_info(env);
00170         struct dt_object_format dof = { 0 };
00171         struct dt_object       *dto;
00172         int                  rc;
00173         ENTRY;
00174 
00175         lu_local_obj_fid(&osi->osi_fid, reg_id);
00176         attr->la_valid = LA_MODE;
00177         attr->la_mode = S_IFREG | 0644;
00178         dof.dof_type = DFT_REGULAR;
00179         /* Find or create the local object by osi_fid. */
00180         dto = dt_find_or_create(env, osp->opd_storage, &osi->osi_fid,
00181                                 &dof, attr);
00182         if (IS_ERR(dto))
00183                 RETURN(dto);
00184 
00185         /* Get attributes of the local object. */
00186         rc = dt_attr_get(env, dto, attr);
00187         if (rc) {
00188                 CERROR("%s: can't be initialized: rc = %d\n",
00189                        osp->opd_obd->obd_name, rc);
00190                 lu_object_put(env, &dto->do_lu);
00191                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
00192         }
00193         RETURN(dto);
00194 }
00195 
00209 static int osp_write_local_file(const struct lu_env *env,
00210                                 struct osp_device *osp,
00211                                 struct dt_object *dt_obj,
00212                                 struct lu_buf *buf,
00213                                 loff_t offset)
00214 {
00215         struct thandle *th;
00216         int rc;
00217 
00218         th = dt_trans_create(env, osp->opd_storage);
00219         if (IS_ERR(th))
00220                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(th));
00221 
00222         rc = dt_declare_record_write(env, dt_obj, buf, offset, th);
00223         if (rc)
00224                 GOTO(out, rc);
00225         rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, osp->opd_storage, th);
00226         if (rc)
00227                 GOTO(out, rc);
00228 
00229         rc = dt_record_write(env, dt_obj, buf, &offset, th);
00230 out:
00231         dt_trans_stop(env, osp->opd_storage, th);
00232         RETURN(rc);
00233 }

00249 static int osp_init_last_objid(const struct lu_env *env, struct osp_device *osp)
00250 {
00251         struct osp_thread_info  *osi = osp_env_info(env);
00252         struct lu_fid           *fid = &osp->opd_last_used_fid;
00253         struct dt_object        *dto;
00254         int                     rc = -EFAULT;
00255         ENTRY;
00256 
00257         dto = osp_find_or_create_local_file(env, osp, &osi->osi_attr,
00258                                             MDD_LOV_OBJ_OID);
00259         if (IS_ERR(dto))
00260                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(dto));
00261 
00262         /* object will be released in device cleanup path */
00263         if (osi->osi_attr.la_size >=
00264             sizeof(osi->osi_id) * (osp->opd_index + 1)) {
00265                 osp_objid_buf_prep(&osi->osi_lb, &osi->osi_off, &fid->f_oid,
00266                                    osp->opd_index);
00267                 rc = dt_record_read(env, dto, &osi->osi_lb, &osi->osi_off);
00268                 if (rc != 0 && rc != -EFAULT)
00269                         GOTO(out, rc);
00270         }
00271 
00272         if (rc == -EFAULT) { /* fresh LAST_ID */
00273                 fid->f_oid = 0;
00274                 osp_objid_buf_prep(&osi->osi_lb, &osi->osi_off, &fid->f_oid,
00275                                    osp->opd_index);
00276                 rc = osp_write_local_file(env, osp, dto, &osi->osi_lb,
00277                                           osi->osi_off);
00278                 if (rc != 0)
00279                         GOTO(out, rc);
00280         }
00281         osp->opd_last_used_oid_file = dto;
00282         RETURN(0);
00283 out:
00284         /* object will be released in device cleanup path */
00285         CERROR("%s: can't initialize lov_objid: rc = %d\n",
00286                osp->opd_obd->obd_name, rc);
00287         lu_object_put(env, &dto->do_lu);
00288         osp->opd_last_used_oid_file = NULL;
00289         RETURN(rc);
00290 }
00291 
00306 static int osp_init_last_seq(const struct lu_env *env, struct osp_device *osp)
00307 {
00308         struct osp_thread_info  *osi = osp_env_info(env);
00309         struct lu_fid           *fid = &osp->opd_last_used_fid;
00310         struct dt_object        *dto;
00311         int                     rc = -EFAULT;
00312         ENTRY;
00313 
00314         dto = osp_find_or_create_local_file(env, osp, &osi->osi_attr,
00315                                             MDD_LOV_OBJ_OSEQ);
00316         if (IS_ERR(dto))
00317                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(dto));
00318 
00319         /* object will be released in device cleanup path */
00320         if (osi->osi_attr.la_size >=
00321             sizeof(osi->osi_id) * (osp->opd_index + 1)) {
00322                 osp_objseq_buf_prep(&osi->osi_lb, &osi->osi_off, &fid->f_seq,
00323                                    osp->opd_index);
00324                 rc = dt_record_read(env, dto, &osi->osi_lb, &osi->osi_off);
00325                 if (rc != 0 && rc != -EFAULT)
00326                         GOTO(out, rc);
00327         }
00328 
00329         if (rc == -EFAULT) { /* fresh OSP */
00330                 fid->f_seq = 0;
00331                 osp_objseq_buf_prep(&osi->osi_lb, &osi->osi_off, &fid->f_seq,
00332                                     osp->opd_index);
00333                 rc = osp_write_local_file(env, osp, dto, &osi->osi_lb,
00334                                           osi->osi_off);
00335                 if (rc != 0)
00336                         GOTO(out, rc);
00337         }
00338         osp->opd_last_used_seq_file = dto;
00339         RETURN(0);
00340 out:
00341         /* object will be released in device cleanup path */
00342         CERROR("%s: can't initialize lov_seq: rc = %d\n",
00343                osp->opd_obd->obd_name, rc);
00344         lu_object_put(env, &dto->do_lu);
00345         osp->opd_last_used_seq_file = NULL;
00346         RETURN(rc);
00347 }
00348 
00362 static int osp_last_used_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct osp_device *osp)
00363 {
00364         struct osp_thread_info *osi = osp_env_info(env);
00365         int                  rc;
00366         ENTRY;
00367 
00368         fid_zero(&osp->opd_last_used_fid);
00369         rc = osp_init_last_objid(env, osp);
00370         if (rc < 0) {
00371                 CERROR("%s: Can not get ids %d from old objid!\n",
00372                        osp->opd_obd->obd_name, rc);
00373                 RETURN(rc);
00374         }
00375 
00376         rc = osp_init_last_seq(env, osp);
00377         if (rc < 0) {
00378                 CERROR("%s: Can not get ids %d from old objid!\n",
00379                        osp->opd_obd->obd_name, rc);
00380                 GOTO(out, rc);
00381         }
00382 
00383         if (fid_oid(&osp->opd_last_used_fid) != 0 &&
00384             fid_seq(&osp->opd_last_used_fid) == 0) {
00385                 /* Just upgrade from the old version,
00386                  * set the seq to be IDIF */
00387                 osp->opd_last_used_fid.f_seq =
00388                    fid_idif_seq(fid_oid(&osp->opd_last_used_fid),
00389                                 osp->opd_index);
00390                 osp_objseq_buf_prep(&osi->osi_lb, &osi->osi_off,
00391                                     &osp->opd_last_used_fid.f_seq,
00392                                     osp->opd_index);
00393                 rc = osp_write_local_file(env, osp, osp->opd_last_used_seq_file,
00394                                           &osi->osi_lb, osi->osi_off);
00395                 if (rc) {
00396                         CERROR("%s : Can not write seq file: rc = %d\n",
00397                                osp->opd_obd->obd_name, rc);
00398                         GOTO(out, rc);
00399                 }
00400         }
00401 
00402         if (!fid_is_zero(&osp->opd_last_used_fid) &&
00403                  !fid_is_sane(&osp->opd_last_used_fid)) {
00404                 CERROR("%s: Got invalid FID "DFID"\n", osp->opd_obd->obd_name,
00405                         PFID(&osp->opd_last_used_fid));
00406                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00407         }
00408 
00409         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: Init last used fid "DFID"\n",
00410                osp->opd_obd->obd_name, PFID(&osp->opd_last_used_fid));
00411 out:
00412         if (rc != 0) {
00413                 if (osp->opd_last_used_oid_file != NULL) {
00414                         lu_object_put(env, &osp->opd_last_used_oid_file->do_lu);
00415                         osp->opd_last_used_oid_file = NULL;
00416                 }
00417                 if (osp->opd_last_used_seq_file != NULL) {
00418                         lu_object_put(env, &osp->opd_last_used_seq_file->do_lu);
00419                         osp->opd_last_used_seq_file = NULL;
00420                 }
00421         }
00422 
00423         RETURN(rc);
00424 }
00425 
00432 static void osp_last_used_fini(const struct lu_env *env, struct osp_device *osp)
00433 {
00434         /* release last_used file */
00435         if (osp->opd_last_used_oid_file != NULL) {
00436                 lu_object_put(env, &osp->opd_last_used_oid_file->do_lu);
00437                 osp->opd_last_used_oid_file = NULL;
00438         }
00439 
00440         if (osp->opd_last_used_seq_file != NULL) {
00441                 lu_object_put(env, &osp->opd_last_used_seq_file->do_lu);
00442                 osp->opd_last_used_seq_file = NULL;
00443         }
00444 }
00445 
00456 static int osp_disconnect(struct osp_device *d)
00457 {
00458         struct obd_import *imp;
00459         int rc = 0;
00460 
00461         imp = d->opd_obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00462 
00463         /* Mark import deactivated now, so we don't try to reconnect if any
00464          * of the cleanup RPCs fails (e.g. ldlm cancel, etc).  We don't
00465          * fully deactivate the import, or that would drop all requests. */
00466         LASSERT(imp != NULL);
00467         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00468         imp->imp_deactive = 1;
00469         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00470 
00471         ptlrpc_deactivate_import(imp);
00472 
00473         /* Some non-replayable imports (MDS's OSCs) are pinged, so just
00474          * delete it regardless.  (It's safe to delete an import that was
00475          * never added.) */
00476         (void)ptlrpc_pinger_del_import(imp);
00477 
00478         rc = ptlrpc_disconnect_import(imp, 0);
00479         if (rc != 0)
00480                 CERROR("%s: can't disconnect: rc = %d\n",
00481                        d->opd_obd->obd_name, rc);
00482 
00483         ptlrpc_invalidate_import(imp);
00484 
00485         RETURN(rc);
00486 }
00487 
00498 static int osp_update_init(struct osp_device *osp)
00499 {
00500         struct l_wait_info      lwi = { 0 };
00501         struct task_struct      *task;
00502 
00503         ENTRY;
00504 
00505         LASSERT(osp->opd_connect_mdt);
00506 
00507         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(osp->opd_update);
00508         if (osp->opd_update == NULL)
00509                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00510 
00511         init_waitqueue_head(&osp->opd_update_thread.t_ctl_waitq);
00512         init_waitqueue_head(&osp->opd_update->ou_waitq);
00513         spin_lock_init(&osp->opd_update->ou_lock);
00514         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&osp->opd_update->ou_list);
00515         osp->opd_update->ou_rpc_version = 1;
00516         osp->opd_update->ou_version = 1;
00517 
00518         /* start thread handling sending updates to the remote MDT */
00519         task = kthread_run(osp_send_update_thread, osp,
00520                            "osp_up%u-%u", osp->opd_index, osp->opd_group);
00521         if (IS_ERR(task)) {
00522                 int rc = PTR_ERR(task);
00523 
00524                 OBD_FREE_PTR(osp->opd_update);
00525                 osp->opd_update = NULL;
00526                 CERROR("%s: can't start precreate thread: rc = %d\n",
00527                        osp->opd_obd->obd_name, rc);
00528                 RETURN(rc);
00529         }
00530 
00531         l_wait_event(osp->opd_update_thread.t_ctl_waitq,
00532                      osp_send_update_thread_running(osp) ||
00533                      osp_send_update_thread_stopped(osp), &lwi);
00534 
00535         RETURN(0);
00536 }
00537 
00546 static void osp_update_fini(const struct lu_env *env, struct osp_device *osp)
00547 {
00548         struct osp_update_request *our;
00549         struct osp_update_request *tmp;
00550         struct osp_updates *ou = osp->opd_update;
00551 
00552         if (ou == NULL)
00553                 return;
00554 
00555         osp->opd_update_thread.t_flags = SVC_STOPPING;
00556         wake_up(&ou->ou_waitq);
00557 
00558         wait_event(osp->opd_update_thread.t_ctl_waitq,
00559                    osp->opd_update_thread.t_flags & SVC_STOPPED);
00560 
00561         /* Remove the left osp thandle from the list */
00562         spin_lock(&ou->ou_lock);
00563         list_for_each_entry_safe(our, tmp, &ou->ou_list,
00564                                  our_list) {
00565                 list_del_init(&our->our_list);
00566                 LASSERT(our->our_th != NULL);
00567                 osp_trans_callback(env, our->our_th, -EIO);
00568                 /* our will be destroyed in osp_thandle_put() */
00569                 osp_thandle_put(our->our_th);
00570         }
00571         spin_unlock(&ou->ou_lock);
00572 
00573         OBD_FREE_PTR(ou);
00574         osp->opd_update = NULL;
00575 }
00576 
00587 static int osp_shutdown(const struct lu_env *env, struct osp_device *d)
00588 {
00589         int                      rc = 0;
00590         ENTRY;
00591 
00592         LASSERT(env);
00593 
00594         rc = osp_disconnect(d);
00595 
00596         if (!d->opd_connect_mdt) {
00597                 /* stop sync thread */
00598                 osp_sync_fini(d);
00599 
00600                 /* stop precreate thread */
00601                 osp_precreate_fini(d);
00602 
00603                 /* release last_used file */
00604                 osp_last_used_fini(env, d);
00605         }
00606 
00607         obd_fid_fini(d->opd_obd);
00608 
00609         RETURN(rc);
00610 }
00611 
00626 static int osp_process_config(const struct lu_env *env,
00627                               struct lu_device *dev, struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
00628 {
00629         struct osp_device               *d = lu2osp_dev(dev);
00630         struct obd_device               *obd = d->opd_obd;
00631         int                              rc;
00632 
00633         ENTRY;
00634 
00635         switch (lcfg->lcfg_command) {
00636         case LCFG_PRE_CLEANUP:
00637                 rc = osp_disconnect(d);
00638                 osp_update_fini(env, d);
00639                 break;
00640         case LCFG_CLEANUP:
00641                 lu_dev_del_linkage(dev->ld_site, dev);
00642                 rc = osp_shutdown(env, d);
00643                 break;
00644         case LCFG_PARAM:
00645                 LASSERT(obd);
00646                 rc = class_process_proc_param(d->opd_connect_mdt ?
00647                                               PARAM_OSP : PARAM_OSC,
00648                                               obd->obd_vars, lcfg, obd);
00649                 if (rc > 0)
00650                         rc = 0;
00651                 if (rc == -ENOSYS) {
00652                         /* class_process_proc_param() haven't found matching
00653                          * parameter and returned ENOSYS so that layer(s)
00654                          * below could use that. But OSP is the bottom, so
00655                          * just ignore it */
00656                         CERROR("%s: unknown param %s\n",
00657                                (char *)lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 0),
00658                                (char *)lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1));
00659                         rc = 0;
00660                 }
00661                 break;
00662         default:
00663                 CERROR("%s: unknown command %u\n",
00664                        (char *)lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 0), lcfg->lcfg_command);
00665                 rc = 0;
00666                 break;
00667         }
00668 
00669         RETURN(rc);
00670 }
00671 
00683 static int osp_recovery_complete(const struct lu_env *env,
00684                                  struct lu_device *dev)
00685 {
00686         struct osp_device       *osp = lu2osp_dev(dev);
00687 
00688         ENTRY;
00689         osp->opd_recovery_completed = 1;
00690 
00691         if (!osp->opd_connect_mdt && osp->opd_pre != NULL)
00692                 wake_up(&osp->opd_pre_waitq);
00693 
00694         RETURN(0);
00695 }
00696 
00697 const struct lu_device_operations osp_lu_ops = {
00698         .ldo_object_alloc       = osp_object_alloc,
00699         .ldo_process_config     = osp_process_config,
00700         .ldo_recovery_complete  = osp_recovery_complete,
00701 };
00702 
00720 static int osp_statfs(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_device *dev,
00721                       struct obd_statfs *sfs)
00722 {
00723         struct osp_device *d = dt2osp_dev(dev);
00724         struct obd_import *imp = d->opd_obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00725 
00726         ENTRY;
00727 
00728         if (imp->imp_state == LUSTRE_IMP_CLOSED)
00729                 RETURN(-ESHUTDOWN);
00730 
00731         if (unlikely(d->opd_imp_active == 0))
00732                 RETURN(-ENOTCONN);
00733 
00734         if (d->opd_pre == NULL)
00735                 RETURN(0);
00736 
00737         /* return recently updated data */
00738         *sfs = d->opd_statfs;
00739 
00740         /*
00741          * layer above osp (usually lod) can use ffree to estimate
00742          * how many objects are available for immediate creation
00743          */
00744         spin_lock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
00745         LASSERTF(fid_seq(&d->opd_pre_last_created_fid) ==
00746                  fid_seq(&d->opd_pre_used_fid),
00747                  "last_created "DFID", next_fid "DFID"\n",
00748                  PFID(&d->opd_pre_last_created_fid),
00749                  PFID(&d->opd_pre_used_fid));
00750         sfs->os_fprecreated = fid_oid(&d->opd_pre_last_created_fid) -
00751                               fid_oid(&d->opd_pre_used_fid);
00752         sfs->os_fprecreated -= d->opd_pre_reserved;
00753         spin_unlock(&d->opd_pre_lock);
00754 
00755         LASSERT(sfs->os_fprecreated <= OST_MAX_PRECREATE * 2);
00756 
00757         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "%s: "LPU64" blocks, "LPU64" free, "LPU64" avail, "
00758                LPU64" files, "LPU64" free files\n", d->opd_obd->obd_name,
00759                sfs->os_blocks, sfs->os_bfree, sfs->os_bavail,
00760                sfs->os_files, sfs->os_ffree);
00761         RETURN(0);
00762 }
00763 
00764 static int osp_sync_timeout(void *data)
00765 {
00766         return 1;
00767 }
00768 
00781 static int osp_sync(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_device *dev)
00782 {
00783         struct osp_device *d = dt2osp_dev(dev);
00784         cfs_time_t         expire;
00785         struct l_wait_info lwi = { 0 };
00786         unsigned long      id, old;
00787         int                rc = 0;
00788         unsigned long      start = cfs_time_current();
00789         ENTRY;
00790 
00791         /* No Sync between MDTs yet. */
00792         if (d->opd_connect_mdt)
00793                 RETURN(0);
00794 
00795         if (unlikely(d->opd_imp_active == 0))
00796                 RETURN(-ENOTCONN);
00797 
00798         id = d->opd_syn_last_used_id;
00799         down_write(&d->opd_async_updates_rwsem);
00800 
00801         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "%s: async updates %d\n", d->opd_obd->obd_name,
00802                atomic_read(&d->opd_async_updates_count));
00803 
00804         /* make sure the connection is fine */
00805         expire = cfs_time_shift(obd_timeout);
00806         lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT(expire - cfs_time_current(), osp_sync_timeout, d);
00807         rc = l_wait_event(d->opd_syn_barrier_waitq,
00808                           atomic_read(&d->opd_async_updates_count) == 0,
00809                           &lwi);
00810         up_write(&d->opd_async_updates_rwsem);
00811         if (rc != 0)
00812                 GOTO(out, rc);
00813 
00814         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "%s: id: used %lu, processed %lu\n",
00815                d->opd_obd->obd_name, id, d->opd_syn_last_processed_id);
00816 
00817         /* wait till all-in-line are processed */
00818         while (d->opd_syn_last_processed_id < id) {
00819 
00820                 old = d->opd_syn_last_processed_id;
00821 
00822                 /* make sure the connection is fine */
00823                 expire = cfs_time_shift(obd_timeout);
00824                 lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT(expire - cfs_time_current(),
00825                                   osp_sync_timeout, d);
00826                 l_wait_event(d->opd_syn_barrier_waitq,
00827                              d->opd_syn_last_processed_id >= id,
00828                              &lwi);
00829 
00830                 if (d->opd_syn_last_processed_id >= id)
00831                         break;
00832 
00833                 if (d->opd_syn_last_processed_id != old) {
00834                         /* some progress have been made,
00835                          * keep trying... */
00836                         continue;
00837                 }
00838 
00839                 /* no changes and expired, something is wrong */
00840                 GOTO(out, rc = -ETIMEDOUT);
00841         }
00842 
00843         /* block new processing (barrier>0 - few callers are possible */
00844         atomic_inc(&d->opd_syn_barrier);
00845 
00846         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "%s: %u in flight\n", d->opd_obd->obd_name,
00847                d->opd_syn_rpc_in_flight);
00848 
00849         /* wait till all-in-flight are replied, so executed by the target */
00850         /* XXX: this is used by LFSCK at the moment, which doesn't require
00851          *      all the changes to be committed, but in general it'd be
00852          *      better to wait till commit */
00853         while (d->opd_syn_rpc_in_flight > 0) {
00854 
00855                 old = d->opd_syn_rpc_in_flight;
00856 
00857                 expire = cfs_time_shift(obd_timeout);
00858                 lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT(expire - cfs_time_current(),
00859                                   osp_sync_timeout, d);
00860                 l_wait_event(d->opd_syn_barrier_waitq,
00861                                 d->opd_syn_rpc_in_flight == 0, &lwi);
00862 
00863                 if (d->opd_syn_rpc_in_flight == 0)
00864                         break;
00865 
00866                 if (d->opd_syn_rpc_in_flight != old) {
00867                         /* some progress have been made */
00868                         continue;
00869                 }
00870 
00871                 /* no changes and expired, something is wrong */
00872                 GOTO(out, rc = -ETIMEDOUT);
00873         }
00874 
00875 out:
00876         /* resume normal processing (barrier=0) */
00877         atomic_dec(&d->opd_syn_barrier);
00878         __osp_sync_check_for_work(d);
00879 
00880         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "%s: done in %lu: rc = %d\n", d->opd_obd->obd_name,
00881                cfs_time_current() - start, rc);
00882 
00883         RETURN(rc);
00884 }
00885 
00886 const struct dt_device_operations osp_dt_ops = {
00887         .dt_statfs       = osp_statfs,
00888         .dt_sync         = osp_sync,
00889         .dt_trans_create = osp_trans_create,
00890         .dt_trans_start  = osp_trans_start,
00891         .dt_trans_stop   = osp_trans_stop,
00892         .dt_trans_cb_add   = osp_trans_cb_add,
00893 };
00894 
00910 static int osp_connect_to_osd(const struct lu_env *env, struct osp_device *osp,
00911                               const char *nextdev)
00912 {
00913         struct obd_connect_data *data = NULL;
00914         struct obd_device       *obd;
00915         int                      rc;
00916 
00917         ENTRY;
00918 
00919         LASSERT(osp->opd_storage_exp == NULL);
00920 
00921         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(data);
00922         if (data == NULL)
00923                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00924 
00925         obd = class_name2obd(nextdev);
00926         if (obd == NULL) {
00927                 CERROR("%s: can't locate next device: %s\n",
00928                        osp->opd_obd->obd_name, nextdev);
00929                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOTCONN);
00930         }
00931 
00932         rc = obd_connect(env, &osp->opd_storage_exp, obd, &obd->obd_uuid, data,
00933                          NULL);
00934         if (rc) {
00935                 CERROR("%s: cannot connect to next dev %s: rc = %d\n",
00936                        osp->opd_obd->obd_name, nextdev, rc);
00937                 GOTO(out, rc);
00938         }
00939 
00940         osp->opd_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev.ld_site =
00941                 osp->opd_storage_exp->exp_obd->obd_lu_dev->ld_site;
00942         LASSERT(osp->opd_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev.ld_site);
00943         osp->opd_storage = lu2dt_dev(osp->opd_storage_exp->exp_obd->obd_lu_dev);
00944 
00945 out:
00946         OBD_FREE_PTR(data);
00947         RETURN(rc);
00948 }
00949 
00963 static int osp_cancel_weight(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
00964 {
00965         if (lock->l_resource->lr_type != LDLM_IBITS)
00966                 RETURN(0);
00967 
00968         RETURN(1);
00969 }
00970 
00996 static int osp_init0(const struct lu_env *env, struct osp_device *osp,
00997                      struct lu_device_type *ldt, struct lustre_cfg *cfg)
00998 {
00999         struct obd_device       *obd;
01000         struct obd_import       *imp;
01001         class_uuid_t            uuid;
01002         char                    *src, *tgt, *mdt, *osdname = NULL;
01003         int                     rc;
01004         long                    idx;
01005 
01006         ENTRY;
01007 
01008         mutex_init(&osp->opd_async_requests_mutex);
01009         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&osp->opd_async_updates);
01010         init_rwsem(&osp->opd_async_updates_rwsem);
01011         atomic_set(&osp->opd_async_updates_count, 0);
01012 
01013         obd = class_name2obd(lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 0));
01014         if (obd == NULL) {
01015                 CERROR("Cannot find obd with name %s\n",
01016                        lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 0));
01017                 RETURN(-ENODEV);
01018         }
01019         osp->opd_obd = obd;
01020 
01021         src = lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 0);
01022         if (src == NULL)
01023                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01024 
01025         tgt = strrchr(src, '-');
01026         if (tgt == NULL) {
01027                 CERROR("%s: invalid target name %s: rc = %d\n",
01028                        osp->opd_obd->obd_name, lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 0),
01029                        -EINVAL);
01030                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01031         }
01032 
01033         if (strncmp(tgt, "-osc", 4) == 0) {
01034                 /* Old OSC name fsname-OSTXXXX-osc */
01035                 for (tgt--; tgt > src && *tgt != '-'; tgt--)
01036                         ;
01037                 if (tgt == src) {
01038                         CERROR("%s: invalid target name %s: rc = %d\n",
01039                                osp->opd_obd->obd_name,
01040                                lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 0), -EINVAL);
01041                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01042                 }
01043 
01044                 if (strncmp(tgt, "-OST", 4) != 0) {
01045                         CERROR("%s: invalid target name %s: rc = %d\n",
01046                                osp->opd_obd->obd_name,
01047                                lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 0), -EINVAL);
01048                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01049                 }
01050 
01051                 idx = simple_strtol(tgt + 4, &mdt, 16);
01052                 if (mdt[0] != '-' || idx > INT_MAX || idx < 0) {
01053                         CERROR("%s: invalid OST index in '%s': rc = %d\n",
01054                                osp->opd_obd->obd_name, src, -EINVAL);
01055                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01056                 }
01057                 osp->opd_index = idx;
01058                 osp->opd_group = 0;
01059                 idx = tgt - src;
01060         } else {
01061                 /* New OSC name fsname-OSTXXXX-osc-MDTXXXX */
01062                 if (strncmp(tgt, "-MDT", 4) != 0 &&
01063                     strncmp(tgt, "-OST", 4) != 0) {
01064                         CERROR("%s: invalid target name %s: rc = %d\n",
01065                                osp->opd_obd->obd_name,
01066                                lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 0), -EINVAL);
01067                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01068                 }
01069 
01070                 idx = simple_strtol(tgt + 4, &mdt, 16);
01071                 if (*mdt != '\0' || idx > INT_MAX || idx < 0) {
01072                         CERROR("%s: invalid OST index in '%s': rc = %d\n",
01073                                osp->opd_obd->obd_name, src, -EINVAL);
01074                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01075                 }
01076 
01077                 /* Get MDT index from the name and set it to opd_group,
01078                  * which will be used by OSP to connect with OST */
01079                 osp->opd_group = idx;
01080                 if (tgt - src <= 12) {
01081                         CERROR("%s: invalid mdt index from %s: rc =%d\n",
01082                                osp->opd_obd->obd_name,
01083                                lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 0), -EINVAL);
01084                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01085                 }
01086 
01087                 if (strncmp(tgt - 12, "-MDT", 4) == 0)
01088                         osp->opd_connect_mdt = 1;
01089 
01090                 idx = simple_strtol(tgt - 8, &mdt, 16);
01091                 if (mdt[0] != '-' || idx > INT_MAX || idx < 0) {
01092                         CERROR("%s: invalid OST index in '%s': rc =%d\n",
01093                                osp->opd_obd->obd_name, src, -EINVAL);
01094                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01095                 }
01096 
01097                 osp->opd_index = idx;
01098                 idx = tgt - src - 12;
01099         }
01100         /* check the fsname length, and after this everything else will fit */
01101         if (idx > MTI_NAME_MAXLEN) {
01102                 CERROR("%s: fsname too long in '%s': rc = %d\n",
01103                        osp->opd_obd->obd_name, src, -EINVAL);
01104                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01105         }
01106 
01107         OBD_ALLOC(osdname, MAX_OBD_NAME);
01108         if (osdname == NULL)
01109                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01110 
01111         memcpy(osdname, src, idx); /* copy just the fsname part */
01112         osdname[idx] = '\0';
01113 
01114         mdt = strstr(mdt, "-MDT");
01115         if (mdt == NULL) /* 1.8 configs don't have "-MDT0000" at the end */
01116                 strcat(osdname, "-MDT0000");
01117         else
01118                 strcat(osdname, mdt);
01119         strcat(osdname, "-osd");
01120         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: connect to %s (%s)\n", obd->obd_name, osdname, src);
01121 
01122         if (osp->opd_connect_mdt) {
01123                 struct client_obd *cli = &osp->opd_obd->u.cli;
01124 
01125                 OBD_ALLOC(cli->cl_rpc_lock, sizeof(*cli->cl_rpc_lock));
01126                 if (!cli->cl_rpc_lock)
01127                         GOTO(out_fini, rc = -ENOMEM);
01128                 osp_init_rpc_lock(cli->cl_rpc_lock);
01129         }
01130 
01131         osp->opd_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev.ld_ops = &osp_lu_ops;
01132         osp->opd_dt_dev.dd_ops = &osp_dt_ops;
01133 
01134         obd->obd_lu_dev = &osp->opd_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev;
01135 
01136         rc = osp_connect_to_osd(env, osp, osdname);
01137         if (rc)
01138                 GOTO(out_fini, rc);
01139 
01140         rc = ptlrpcd_addref();
01141         if (rc)
01142                 GOTO(out_disconnect, rc);
01143 
01144         rc = client_obd_setup(obd, cfg);
01145         if (rc) {
01146                 CERROR("%s: can't setup obd: rc = %d\n", osp->opd_obd->obd_name,
01147                        rc);
01148                 GOTO(out_ref, rc);
01149         }
01150 
01151         osp_lprocfs_init(osp);
01152 
01153         rc = obd_fid_init(osp->opd_obd, NULL, osp->opd_connect_mdt ?
01154                           LUSTRE_SEQ_METADATA : LUSTRE_SEQ_DATA);
01155         if (rc) {
01156                 CERROR("%s: fid init error: rc = %d\n",
01157                        osp->opd_obd->obd_name, rc);
01158                 GOTO(out_proc, rc);
01159         }
01160 
01161         if (!osp->opd_connect_mdt) {
01162                 /* Initialize last id from the storage - will be
01163                  * used in orphan cleanup. */
01164                 rc = osp_last_used_init(env, osp);
01165                 if (rc)
01166                         GOTO(out_fid, rc);
01167 
01168 
01169                 /* Initialize precreation thread, it handles new
01170                  * connections as well. */
01171                 rc = osp_init_precreate(osp);
01172                 if (rc)
01173                         GOTO(out_last_used, rc);
01174 
01175                 /*
01176                  * Initialize synhronization mechanism taking
01177                  * care of propogating changes to OST in near
01178                  * transactional manner.
01179                  */
01180                 rc = osp_sync_init(env, osp);
01181                 if (rc < 0)
01182                         GOTO(out_precreat, rc);
01183         } else {
01184                 rc = osp_update_init(osp);
01185                 if (rc != 0)
01186                         GOTO(out_fid, rc);
01187         }
01188 
01189         ns_register_cancel(obd->obd_namespace, osp_cancel_weight);
01190 
01191         /*
01192          * Initiate connect to OST
01193          */
01194         ll_generate_random_uuid(uuid);
01195         class_uuid_unparse(uuid, &osp->opd_cluuid);
01196 
01197         imp = obd->u.cli.cl_import;
01198 
01199         rc = ptlrpc_init_import(imp);
01200         if (rc)
01201                 GOTO(out, rc);
01202         if (osdname)
01203                 OBD_FREE(osdname, MAX_OBD_NAME);
01204         RETURN(0);
01205 
01206 out:
01207         if (!osp->opd_connect_mdt)
01208                 /* stop sync thread */
01209                 osp_sync_fini(osp);
01210 out_precreat:
01211         /* stop precreate thread */
01212         if (!osp->opd_connect_mdt)
01213                 osp_precreate_fini(osp);
01214         else
01215                 osp_update_fini(env, osp);
01216 out_last_used:
01217         if (!osp->opd_connect_mdt)
01218                 osp_last_used_fini(env, osp);
01219 out_fid:
01220         obd_fid_fini(osp->opd_obd);
01221 out_proc:
01222         ptlrpc_lprocfs_unregister_obd(obd);
01223         lprocfs_obd_cleanup(obd);
01224         if (osp->opd_symlink)
01225                 lprocfs_remove(&osp->opd_symlink);
01226         client_obd_cleanup(obd);
01227 out_ref:
01228         ptlrpcd_decref();
01229 out_disconnect:
01230         if (osp->opd_connect_mdt) {
01231                 struct client_obd *cli = &osp->opd_obd->u.cli;
01232                 if (cli->cl_rpc_lock != NULL) {
01233                         OBD_FREE_PTR(cli->cl_rpc_lock);
01234                         cli->cl_rpc_lock = NULL;
01235                 }
01236         }
01237         obd_disconnect(osp->opd_storage_exp);
01238 out_fini:
01239         if (osdname)
01240                 OBD_FREE(osdname, MAX_OBD_NAME);
01241         RETURN(rc);
01242 }
01243 
01255 static struct lu_device *osp_device_free(const struct lu_env *env,
01256                                          struct lu_device *lu)
01257 {
01258         struct osp_device *osp = lu2osp_dev(lu);
01259 
01260         if (atomic_read(&lu->ld_ref) && lu->ld_site) {
01261                 LIBCFS_DEBUG_MSG_DATA_DECL(msgdata, D_ERROR, NULL);
01262                 lu_site_print(env, lu->ld_site, &msgdata, lu_cdebug_printer);
01263         }
01264         dt_device_fini(&osp->opd_dt_dev);
01265         OBD_FREE_PTR(osp);
01266 
01267         return NULL;
01268 }
01269 
01283 static struct lu_device *osp_device_alloc(const struct lu_env *env,
01284                                           struct lu_device_type *type,
01285                                           struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
01286 {
01287         struct osp_device *osp;
01288         struct lu_device  *ld;
01289 
01290         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(osp);
01291         if (osp == NULL) {
01292                 ld = ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
01293         } else {
01294                 int rc;
01295 
01296                 ld = osp2lu_dev(osp);
01297                 dt_device_init(&osp->opd_dt_dev, type);
01298                 rc = osp_init0(env, osp, type, lcfg);
01299                 if (rc != 0) {
01300                         osp_device_free(env, ld);
01301                         ld = ERR_PTR(rc);
01302                 }
01303         }
01304         return ld;
01305 }
01306 
01319 static struct lu_device *osp_device_fini(const struct lu_env *env,
01320                                          struct lu_device *ld)
01321 {
01322         struct osp_device *osp = lu2osp_dev(ld);
01323         struct obd_import *imp;
01324         int                rc;
01325 
01326         ENTRY;
01327 
01328         if (osp->opd_async_requests != NULL) {
01329                 osp_update_request_destroy(osp->opd_async_requests);
01330                 osp->opd_async_requests = NULL;
01331         }
01332 
01333         if (osp->opd_storage_exp)
01334                 obd_disconnect(osp->opd_storage_exp);
01335 
01336         imp = osp->opd_obd->u.cli.cl_import;
01337 
01338         if (osp->opd_symlink)
01339                 lprocfs_remove(&osp->opd_symlink);
01340 
01341         LASSERT(osp->opd_obd);
01342         ptlrpc_lprocfs_unregister_obd(osp->opd_obd);
01343         lprocfs_obd_cleanup(osp->opd_obd);
01344 
01345         if (osp->opd_connect_mdt) {
01346                 struct client_obd *cli = &osp->opd_obd->u.cli;
01347                 if (cli->cl_rpc_lock != NULL) {
01348                         OBD_FREE_PTR(cli->cl_rpc_lock);
01349                         cli->cl_rpc_lock = NULL;
01350                 }
01351         }
01352 
01353         rc = client_obd_cleanup(osp->opd_obd);
01354         if (rc != 0) {
01355                 ptlrpcd_decref();
01356                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
01357         }
01358 
01359         ptlrpcd_decref();
01360 
01361         RETURN(NULL);
01362 }
01363 
01369 static int osp_reconnect(const struct lu_env *env,
01370                          struct obd_export *exp, struct obd_device *obd,
01371                          struct obd_uuid *cluuid,
01372                          struct obd_connect_data *data,
01373                          void *localdata)
01374 {
01375         return 0;
01376 }
01377 
01378 /*
01379  * Implementation of obd_ops::o_connect
01380  *
01381  * Connect OSP to the remote target (MDT or OST). Allocate the
01382  * export and return it to the LOD, which calls this function
01383  * for each OSP to connect it to the remote target. This function
01384  * is currently only called once per OSP.
01385  *
01386  * \param[in] env       execution environment
01387  * \param[out] exp      export connected to OSP
01388  * \param[in] obd       OSP device
01389  * \param[in] cluuid    OSP device client uuid
01390  * \param[in] data      connect_data to be used to connect to the remote
01391  *                      target
01392  * \param[in] localdata necessary for the API interface, but not used in
01393  *                      this function
01394  *
01395  * \retval 0            0 if the connection succeeded.
01396  * \retval negative     negative errno if the connection failed.
01397  */
01398 static int osp_obd_connect(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export **exp,
01399                            struct obd_device *obd, struct obd_uuid *cluuid,
01400                            struct obd_connect_data *data, void *localdata)
01401 {
01402         struct osp_device       *osp = lu2osp_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
01403         struct obd_connect_data *ocd;
01404         struct obd_import       *imp;
01405         struct lustre_handle     conn;
01406         int                      rc;
01407 
01408         ENTRY;
01409 
01410         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "connect #%d\n", osp->opd_connects);
01411 
01412         rc = class_connect(&conn, obd, cluuid);
01413         if (rc)
01414                 RETURN(rc);
01415 
01416         *exp = class_conn2export(&conn);
01417         /* Why should there ever be more than 1 connect? */
01418         osp->opd_connects++;
01419         LASSERT(osp->opd_connects == 1);
01420 
01421         osp->opd_exp = *exp;
01422 
01423         imp = osp->opd_obd->u.cli.cl_import;
01424         imp->imp_dlm_handle = conn;
01425 
01426         LASSERT(data != NULL);
01427         LASSERT(data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_INDEX);
01428         ocd = &imp->imp_connect_data;
01429         *ocd = *data;
01430 
01431         imp->imp_connect_flags_orig = ocd->ocd_connect_flags;
01432 
01433         ocd->ocd_version = LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE;
01434         ocd->ocd_index = data->ocd_index;
01435         imp->imp_connect_flags_orig = ocd->ocd_connect_flags;
01436 
01437         rc = ptlrpc_connect_import(imp);
01438         if (rc) {
01439                 CERROR("%s: can't connect obd: rc = %d\n", obd->obd_name, rc);
01440                 GOTO(out, rc);
01441         } else {
01442                 osp->opd_obd->u.cli.cl_seq->lcs_exp =
01443                                 class_export_get(osp->opd_exp);
01444         }
01445 
01446         ptlrpc_pinger_add_import(imp);
01447 out:
01448         RETURN(rc);
01449 }
01450 
01463 static int osp_obd_disconnect(struct obd_export *exp)
01464 {
01465         struct obd_device *obd = exp->exp_obd;
01466         struct osp_device *osp = lu2osp_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
01467         int                rc;
01468         ENTRY;
01469 
01470         /* Only disconnect the underlying layers on the final disconnect. */
01471         LASSERT(osp->opd_connects == 1);
01472         osp->opd_connects--;
01473 
01474         rc = class_disconnect(exp);
01475         if (rc) {
01476                 CERROR("%s: class disconnect error: rc = %d\n",
01477                        obd->obd_name, rc);
01478                 RETURN(rc);
01479         }
01480 
01481         /* destroy the device */
01482         class_manual_cleanup(obd);
01483 
01484         RETURN(rc);
01485 }
01486 
01503 static int osp_obd_statfs(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
01504                           struct obd_statfs *osfs, __u64 unused, __u32 flags)
01505 {
01506         struct obd_statfs       *msfs;
01507         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
01508         struct obd_import       *imp = NULL;
01509         int                      rc;
01510 
01511         ENTRY;
01512 
01513         /* Since the request might also come from lprocfs, so we need
01514          * sync this with client_disconnect_export Bug15684 */
01515         down_read(&exp->exp_obd->u.cli.cl_sem);
01516         if (exp->exp_obd->u.cli.cl_import)
01517                 imp = class_import_get(exp->exp_obd->u.cli.cl_import);
01518         up_read(&exp->exp_obd->u.cli.cl_sem);
01519         if (!imp)
01520                 RETURN(-ENODEV);
01521 
01522         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(imp, &RQF_OST_STATFS);
01523 
01524         class_import_put(imp);
01525 
01526         if (req == NULL)
01527                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01528 
01529         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_OST_VERSION, OST_STATFS);
01530         if (rc) {
01531                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
01532                 RETURN(rc);
01533         }
01534         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
01535         req->rq_request_portal = OST_CREATE_PORTAL;
01536         ptlrpc_at_set_req_timeout(req);
01537 
01538         if (flags & OBD_STATFS_NODELAY) {
01539                 /* procfs requests not want stat in wait for avoid deadlock */
01540                 req->rq_no_resend = 1;
01541                 req->rq_no_delay = 1;
01542         }
01543 
01544         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
01545         if (rc)
01546                 GOTO(out, rc);
01547 
01548         msfs = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OBD_STATFS);
01549         if (msfs == NULL)
01550                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
01551 
01552         *osfs = *msfs;
01553 
01554         EXIT;
01555 out:
01556         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01557         return rc;
01558 }
01559 
01574 static int osp_import_event(struct obd_device *obd, struct obd_import *imp,
01575                             enum obd_import_event event)
01576 {
01577         struct osp_device *d = lu2osp_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
01578 
01579         switch (event) {
01580         case IMP_EVENT_DISCON:
01581                 d->opd_got_disconnected = 1;
01582                 d->opd_imp_connected = 0;
01583                 if (d->opd_connect_mdt)
01584                         break;
01585 
01586                 if (d->opd_pre != NULL) {
01587                         osp_pre_update_status(d, -ENODEV);
01588                         wake_up(&d->opd_pre_waitq);
01589                 }
01590 
01591                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "got disconnected\n");
01592                 break;
01593         case IMP_EVENT_INACTIVE:
01594                 d->opd_imp_active = 0;
01595                 d->opd_imp_connected = 0;
01596                 d->opd_obd->obd_inactive = 1;
01597                 if (d->opd_connect_mdt)
01598                         break;
01599 
01600                 if (d->opd_pre != NULL) {
01601                         osp_pre_update_status(d, -ENODEV);
01602                         wake_up(&d->opd_pre_waitq);
01603                 }
01604 
01605                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "got inactive\n");
01606                 break;
01607         case IMP_EVENT_ACTIVE:
01608                 d->opd_imp_active = 1;
01609 
01610                 if (d->opd_got_disconnected)
01611                         d->opd_new_connection = 1;
01612                 d->opd_imp_connected = 1;
01613                 d->opd_imp_seen_connected = 1;
01614                 d->opd_obd->obd_inactive = 0;
01615                 if (d->opd_connect_mdt)
01616                         break;
01617 
01618                 if (d->opd_pre != NULL)
01619                         wake_up(&d->opd_pre_waitq);
01620 
01621                 __osp_sync_check_for_work(d);
01622                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "got connected\n");
01623                 break;
01624         case IMP_EVENT_INVALIDATE:
01625                 if (d->opd_connect_mdt)
01626                         osp_invalidate_request(d);
01627 
01628                 if (obd->obd_namespace == NULL)
01629                         break;
01630                 ldlm_namespace_cleanup(obd->obd_namespace, LDLM_FL_LOCAL_ONLY);
01631                 break;
01632         case IMP_EVENT_OCD:
01633         case IMP_EVENT_DEACTIVATE:
01634         case IMP_EVENT_ACTIVATE:
01635                 break;
01636         default:
01637                 CERROR("%s: unsupported import event: %#x\n",
01638                        obd->obd_name, event);
01639         }
01640         return 0;
01641 }
01642 
01660 static int osp_iocontrol(unsigned int cmd, struct obd_export *exp, int len,
01661                          void *karg, void __user *uarg)
01662 {
01663         struct obd_device       *obd = exp->exp_obd;
01664         struct osp_device       *d;
01665         struct obd_ioctl_data   *data = karg;
01666         int                      rc = 0;
01667 
01668         ENTRY;
01669 
01670         LASSERT(obd->obd_lu_dev);
01671         d = lu2osp_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
01672         LASSERT(d->opd_dt_dev.dd_ops == &osp_dt_ops);
01673 
01674         if (!try_module_get(THIS_MODULE)) {
01675                 CERROR("%s: cannot get module '%s'\n", obd->obd_name,
01676                        module_name(THIS_MODULE));
01677                 return -EINVAL;
01678         }
01679 
01680         switch (cmd) {
01681         case OBD_IOC_CLIENT_RECOVER:
01682                 rc = ptlrpc_recover_import(obd->u.cli.cl_import,
01683                                            data->ioc_inlbuf1, 0);
01684                 if (rc > 0)
01685                         rc = 0;
01686                 break;
01687         case IOC_OSC_SET_ACTIVE:
01688                 rc = ptlrpc_set_import_active(obd->u.cli.cl_import,
01689                                               data->ioc_offset);
01690                 break;
01691         case OBD_IOC_PING_TARGET:
01692                 rc = ptlrpc_obd_ping(obd);
01693                 break;
01694         default:
01695                 CERROR("%s: unrecognized ioctl %#x by %s\n", obd->obd_name,
01696                        cmd, current_comm());
01697                 rc = -ENOTTY;
01698         }
01699         module_put(THIS_MODULE);
01700         return rc;
01701 }
01702 
01703 
01721 static int osp_obd_get_info(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
01722                             __u32 keylen, void *key, __u32 *vallen, void *val)
01723 {
01724         int rc = -EINVAL;
01725 
01726         if (KEY_IS(KEY_OSP_CONNECTED)) {
01727                 struct obd_device       *obd = exp->exp_obd;
01728                 struct osp_device       *osp;
01729 
01730                 if (!obd->obd_set_up || obd->obd_stopping)
01731                         RETURN(-EAGAIN);
01732 
01733                 osp = lu2osp_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
01734                 LASSERT(osp);
01735                 /*
01736                  * 1.8/2.0 behaviour is that OST being connected once at least
01737                  * is considered "healthy". and one "healthy" OST is enough to
01738                  * allow lustre clients to connect to MDS
01739                  */
01740                 RETURN(!osp->opd_imp_seen_connected);
01741         }
01742 
01743         RETURN(rc);
01744 }
01745 
01746 static int osp_obd_set_info_async(const struct lu_env *env,
01747                                   struct obd_export *exp,
01748                                   u32 keylen, void *key,
01749                                   u32 vallen, void *val,
01750                                   struct ptlrpc_request_set *set)
01751 {
01752         struct obd_device       *obd = exp->exp_obd;
01753         struct obd_import       *imp = obd->u.cli.cl_import;
01754         struct osp_device       *osp;
01755         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
01756         char                    *tmp;
01757         int                      rc;
01758 
01759         if (KEY_IS(KEY_SPTLRPC_CONF)) {
01760                 sptlrpc_conf_client_adapt(exp->exp_obd);
01761                 RETURN(0);
01762         }
01763 
01764         LASSERT(set != NULL);
01765         if (!obd->obd_set_up || obd->obd_stopping)
01766                 RETURN(-EAGAIN);
01767         osp = lu2osp_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
01768 
01769         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(imp, &RQF_OBD_SET_INFO);
01770         if (req == NULL)
01771                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01772 
01773         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_SETINFO_KEY,
01774                              RCL_CLIENT, keylen);
01775         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_SETINFO_VAL,
01776                              RCL_CLIENT, vallen);
01777         if (osp->opd_connect_mdt)
01778                 rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION, MDS_SET_INFO);
01779         else
01780                 rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_OST_VERSION, OST_SET_INFO);
01781         if (rc) {
01782                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
01783                 RETURN(rc);
01784         }
01785 
01786         tmp = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_SETINFO_KEY);
01787         memcpy(tmp, key, keylen);
01788         tmp = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_SETINFO_VAL);
01789         memcpy(tmp, val, vallen);
01790 
01791         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
01792         ptlrpc_set_add_req(set, req);
01793         ptlrpc_check_set(NULL, set);
01794 
01795         RETURN(0);
01796 }
01797 
01821 static int osp_fid_alloc(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
01822                          struct lu_fid *fid, struct md_op_data *unused)
01823 {
01824         struct client_obd       *cli = &exp->exp_obd->u.cli;
01825         struct osp_device       *osp = lu2osp_dev(exp->exp_obd->obd_lu_dev);
01826         struct lu_client_seq    *seq = cli->cl_seq;
01827         ENTRY;
01828 
01829         LASSERT(osp->opd_obd->u.cli.cl_seq != NULL);
01830         /* Sigh, fid client is not ready yet */
01831         LASSERT(osp->opd_obd->u.cli.cl_seq->lcs_exp != NULL);
01832 
01833         RETURN(seq_client_alloc_fid(env, seq, fid));
01834 }

01914 static int __init osp_init(void)
01915 {
01916         struct obd_type *type;
01917         int rc;
01918 
01919         rc = lu_kmem_init(osp_caches);
01920         if (rc)
01921                 return rc;
01922 
01923 
01924         rc = class_register_type(&osp_obd_device_ops, NULL, true, NULL,
01925                                  LUSTRE_OSP_NAME, &osp_device_type);
01926         if (rc != 0) {
01927                 lu_kmem_fini(osp_caches);
01928                 return rc;
01929         }
01930 
01931         rc = class_register_type(&lwp_obd_device_ops, NULL, true, NULL,
01932                                  LUSTRE_LWP_NAME, &lwp_device_type);
01933         if (rc != 0) {
01934                 class_unregister_type(LUSTRE_OSP_NAME);
01935                 lu_kmem_fini(osp_caches);
01936                 return rc;
01937         }
01938 
01939         /* Note: add_rec/delcare_add_rec will be only used by catalogs */
01940         osp_mds_ost_orig_logops = llog_osd_ops;
01941         osp_mds_ost_orig_logops.lop_add = llog_cat_add_rec;
01942         osp_mds_ost_orig_logops.lop_declare_add = llog_cat_declare_add_rec;
01943 
01944         /* create "osc" entry in procfs for compatibility purposes */
01945         type = class_search_type(LUSTRE_OSC_NAME);
01946         if (type != NULL && type->typ_procroot != NULL)
01947                 return rc;
01948 
01949         type = class_search_type(LUSTRE_OSP_NAME);
01950         type->typ_procsym = lprocfs_register("osc", proc_lustre_root,
01951                                              NULL, NULL);
01952         if (IS_ERR(type->typ_procsym)) {
01953                 CERROR("osp: can't create compat entry \"osc\": %d\n",
01954                        (int) PTR_ERR(type->typ_procsym));
01955                 type->typ_procsym = NULL;
01956         }
01957         return rc;
01958 }
01959 
01966 static void __exit osp_exit(void)
01967 {
01968         class_unregister_type(LUSTRE_LWP_NAME);
01969         class_unregister_type(LUSTRE_OSP_NAME);
01970         lu_kmem_fini(osp_caches);
01971 }

01974 MODULE_DESCRIPTION("Lustre OSD Storage Proxy ("LUSTRE_OSP_NAME")");
01975 MODULE_VERSION(LUSTRE_VERSION_STRING);

01978 module_init(osp_init);
01979 module_exit(osp_exit);
